metadata.title: CVE-2017-7547 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
PostgreSQL versions before 9.2.22, 9.3.18, 9.4.13, 9.5.8 and 9.6.4 arevulnerable to authorization flaw allowing remote authenticated attackers toretrieve passwords from the user mappings defined by the foreign serverowners without actually having the privileges to do so.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7547` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 10.1-1
libecpg6 - 10.1-1
libpgtypes3 - 10.1-1
libpq5 - 10.1-1
postgresql-10 - 10.1-1
postgresql-client-10 - 10.1-1
postgresql-plperl-10 - 10.1-1
postgresql-plpython-10 - 10.1-1
postgresql-plpython3-10 - 10.1-1
postgresql-pltcl-10 - 10.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-10 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.1-1').
